Suppose you are given an array, can you modify it to make all the elements non-negatives?
[-2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3]

Yes, you can modify the array to make all the elements non-negative by converting all negative numbers to zero or by taking the absolute value of each element. Here are two ways to achieve that:

1. **Convert negative numbers to zero:**

   ```python
   array = [-2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3]
   modified_array = [x if x >= 0 else 0 for x in array]
   print(modified_array)
   ```

   This will give you: `[0, 0, 0, 1, 2, 3]`

2. **Take the absolute value of each element:**

   ```python
   array = [-2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3]
   modified_array = [abs(x) for x in array]
   print(modified_array)
   ```

   This will give you: `[2, 1, 0, 1, 2, 3]`

You can choose the method that best fits your needs.
